page.title: 01GAZETTEER ALL ABOUT WYTHALL
page.content: The houses are very spread out and there are lots more fields than buildings.Most of the land is used for rough grazing.The new part of the M42 is being built through the bottom end of the D-Block.The main dual carriageway A435 goes through from B'ham.There are lots of activities like Rangers,Guides,Brownies,Scouts and Cubs.There are 7 football clubs and 4 riding schools.The Dramatic Society both for adults and children puts on lots of plays.There are three clubs for pensioners and school children and guides visit.The Red Cross and the Round Table help people.There are two golf clubs at Fulford Hall and Weatheroak Hall which are both old buildings. There is lots of conservation in Wythall.We want to look after the land.{Meadow Green}
